line.comment: * -4 Select Value Slider {INT, -4, STRING, "text", ARRAY, {value1, value2, value3}, INT, currentSelect, VALUE, RETURN ID}
* -5 Trade Bar Display {INT, -5, STRING, "text", INT, min, INT, max, INT, current, STRING, retValue, STRING, left, STRING, right}
* -12 Select, Run Script {INT, -12, STRING, "text", ARRAY, {value1, value2, value3}, INT, currentSelect}

* -21 Dynamic Trade Bar {INT, -21, STRING, "text", INT, min, INT, max, INT, current, STRING, retValue, STRING, left, STRING, right, STRING, FormatWrapper, INT, 19:OnlyUpdateCurrentOnEnter, INT, 21:currentholder}
* -22 Value Slider/Match {INT, -22, STRING, "text", ARRAY, {value1, value2, value3}, ARRAY, {display1, display2, display3}, INT, currentSelect, VALUE, RETURN ID}
* -1 Open menu without closing {INT, -1, STRING, "scriptname", arg1, arg2...}
* -2 Runs a script on selection {INT, -1, STRING, "scriptname", arg1, arg2...}
* Returns null if the users input is only changling the selection of the menu
* You can put code in here to handle things based on what the user has selected
* Previous Assist menu selection, if any. If a ship type is in the array it means
* it wasn't previously selected, otherwise we assume it was selected.
* Put values, like value switch values and other init here
* The following commented block is for performance sensitive menus. Uncommenting calls the menu control write refresh only when UI control is manipulated.
* If invalid user input just ignore this action.
* Save the current selection to the named gorup.
* If this is the first named group, we replace the current selection with it, so remove
* The new current group is the newly named group.
* This should not have happened since we make the "Delete group" item unselectable
* Save and delete the current group selection.
* If the removed group was the last one in the iteration order we get "null" for it
* even tho there are groups saved so try to get the first group then.
* If no named groups are left, bring back the "null" group.
* Current group becomes the next group.
* If we have no named groups them the "delete group" item is grayed out and unselectable.
* Get a user input string, trim and return it.
* INPUT: $Title - the title of the input box
* OUTPUT: $UserInput - the string returned from the user, null on errors
* Trim the corporation name, we add our own whitespace when prefixing it to ship names.
* TODO(litcube): remove this sub and use the new "table clone" command that Jack08 is adding.

sval.val: -4 Select Value Slider {INT, -4, STRING, "text", ARRAY, {value1, value2, value3}, INT, currentSelect, VALUE, RETURN ID}
-5 Trade Bar Display {INT, -5, STRING, "text", INT, min, INT, max, INT, current, STRING, retValue, STRING, left, STRING, right}
-12 Select, Run Script {INT, -12, STRING, "text", ARRAY, {value1, value2, value3}, INT, currentSelect}

-21 Dynamic Trade Bar {INT, -21, STRING, "text", INT, min, INT, max, INT, current, STRING, retValue, STRING, left, STRING, right, STRING, FormatWrapper, INT, 19:OnlyUpdateCurrentOnEnter, INT, 21:currentholder}
-22 Value Slider/Match {INT, -22, STRING, "text", ARRAY, {value1, value2, value3}, ARRAY, {display1, display2, display3}, INT, currentSelect, VALUE, RETURN ID}
-1 Open menu without closing {INT, -1, STRING, "scriptname", arg1, arg2...}
-2 Runs a script on selection {INT, -1, STRING, "scriptname", arg1, arg2...}
Returns null if the users input is only changling the selection of the menu
You can put code in here to handle things based on what the user has selected
Previous Assist menu selection, if any. If a ship type is in the array it means
it wasn't previously selected, otherwise we assume it was selected.
Put values, like value switch values and other init here
The following commented block is for performance sensitive menus. Uncommenting calls the menu control write refresh only when UI control is manipulated.
If invalid user input just ignore this action.
Save the current selection to the named gorup.
If this is the first named group, we replace the current selection with it, so remove
The new current group is the newly named group.
This should not have happened since we make the "Delete group" item unselectable
Save and delete the current group selection.
If the removed group was the last one in the iteration order we get "null" for it
even tho there are groups saved so try to get the first group then.
If no named groups are left, bring back the "null" group.
Current group becomes the next group.
If we have no named groups them the "delete group" item is grayed out and unselectable.
Get a user input string, trim and return it.
INPUT: $Title - the title of the input box
OUTPUT: $UserInput - the string returned from the user, null on errors
Trim the corporation name, we add our own whitespace when prefixing it to ship names.
TODO(litcube): remove this sub and use the new "table clone" command that Jack08 is adding.
